org.microbean.jersey.netty

Class JerseyChannelInitializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerAdapter
      • io.netty.channel.ChannelInboundHandlerAdapter
        • io.netty.channel.ChannelInitializer<Channel>
          • org.microbean.jersey.netty.JerseyChannelInitializer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, ChannelInboundHandler

    public class JerseyChannelInitializer
extends ChannelInitializer<Channel>
    A ChannelInitializer that sets up Jersey integration.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    ChannelInitializer, initChannel(Channel)

    • Constructor Detail

      • JerseyChannelInitializer

        public JerseyChannelInitializer(URI baseUri,
                                SslContext sslContext,
                                ApplicationHandler applicationHandler,
                                BiFunction<? super ChannelHandlerContext,? super HttpRequest,? extends SecurityContext> securityContextBiFunction)
        Creates a new JerseyChannelInitializer.
        Parameters:
        baseUri - the base URI of the Jersey application; may be null in which case the return value resulting from invoking URI.create("/") will be used instead
        sslContext - an SslContext that may be used to create an SslHandler; may be null
        applicationHandler - the ApplicationHandler representing Jersey; may be null in which case a new ApplicationHandler will be used instead
        securityContextBiFunction - a BiFunction that returns a SecurityContext when supplied with a ChannelHandlerContext and an HttpRequest; may be null

    • Method Detail

      • initChannel

        public final void initChannel(Channel channel)
        Sets up Netty with Jersey application support.
        Specified by:
        initChannel in class ChannelInitializer<Channel>
        Parameters:
        channel - the Channel representing a networking connection to the outside world; may be null in which case no action will be taken
        See Also:
        Channel.pipeline(), ChannelPipeline.addLast(String, ChannelHandler), preInitChannel(Channel), postInitChannel(Channel)

      • preInitChannel

        protected void preInitChannel(Channel channel)
        A hook for performing Channel initialization before the Jersey integration is set up.

        This implementation installs a LoggingHandler.

        Overrides must not call initChannel(Channel) or an infinite loop will result.

        Parameters:
        channel - the Channel being initialized; may be null in which case no action will be taken
        See Also:
        initChannel(Channel), ChannelPipeline.addLast(String, ChannelHandler)

      • postInitChannel

        protected void postInitChannel(Channel channel)
        A hook for performing Channel initialization after the Jersey integration is set up.

        This implementation does nothing.

        Overrides must not call initChannel(Channel) or an infinite loop will result.

        Parameters:
        channel - the Channel being initialized; may be null in which case no action will be taken
        See Also:
        initChannel(Channel), ChannelPipeline.addLast(String, ChannelHandler)

      • createSslHandler

        protected SslHandler createSslHandler(SslContext sslContext,
                                      ByteBufAllocator byteBufAllocator)
        Creates and returns a new SslHandler when invoked.

        This method never returns null.

        Overrides of this method must not return null.

        Parameters:
        sslContext - the SslContext that may assist in the creation; must not be null
        byteBufAllocator - a ByteBufAllocator that may assist in the creation; must not be null
        Returns:
        a new SslHandler; never null
        See Also:
        SslContext.newHandler(ByteBufAllocator)
